Fachrul Razi di DPR Ditanya Akreditasi Perguruan Tinggi Keagamaan
07 Nov 2019, 04:39 by Antara, Purwanto
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta -Ketua Komisi VIII Dewan Perwakilan Rakyat Yandri Susanto mempertanyakan 481 perguruan tinggi keagamaan Islam negeri (PTKIN) yang belum terakreditasi.
"Sejumlah 481 PTKIN yang belum terakreditasi, ini persoalan serius," kata Yandri di sela rapat kerja bersama DPR-Kementerian Agama mengenai evaluasi anggaran tahun 2019 dan rencana anggaran 2020 di Jakarta, Kamis.
Menurut dia, apabila PTKIN tersebut tidak kunjung mendapat akreditasi maka akan menyulitkan mahasiswa kampus terkait dalam mencari pekerjaan.
Politisi Partai Amanat Nasional itu mengatakan terdapat sejumlah instansi yang menyeleksi calon karyawannya dengan salah satu pertimbangannya akreditas kampus terkait.
"Kalau nggak terakreditasi maka akan sulit mahasiswanya mencari pekerjaan. Untuk jadi ASN atau pekerjaan lain," kata dia.
Adapun rapat kerja antara DPR dan Kementerian Agama itu dihadiri para pimpinan Komisi VIII, termasuk Menteri Agama Fachrul Razi beserta jajarannya.
Saat berita ditulis, Menag memaparkan program-program Kemenag yang sudah dijalankan.
Sebagai rapat perdana di era anggota legislatif dan Menag yang baru, kesempatan tersebut juga menjadi ajang kedua belah pihak untuk saling mendalami partner kerja yaitu DPR selaku pengawas pemerintahan, sementara Kementerian Agama sebagai eksekutif.

Fachrul Razi at the DPR was asked about the Accreditation of Religious Higher Education
Nov 7 2019, 04:39 by Antara, Purwanto
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - Chairperson of Commission VIII of the House of Representatives Yandri Susanto questioned 481 state Islamic religious colleges (PTKIN) that have not been accredited.
"As many as 481 PTKIN have not been accredited, this is a serious problem," Yandri said during a joint working meeting with the DPR-Ministry of Religion regarding the evaluation of the 2019 budget and the 2020 budget plan in Jakarta on Thursday.
According to him, if the PTKIN did not get accreditation, it would make it difficult for campus students to find work.
The National Mandate Party politician said there are a number of agencies that select prospective employees with one consideration of the associated campus accreditation.
"If it is not accredited, it will be difficult for students to find work. To become an ASN or another job," he said.
The working meeting between the DPR and the Ministry of Religion was attended by leaders of Commission VIII, including Minister of Religion Fachrul Razi and his staff.
When the news was written, the Minister of Religion explained the Ministry of Religion's programs that had been carried out.
As an inaugural meeting in the era of new legislative members and the Minister of Religion, the opportunity was also a place for both parties to explore each other's work partners, namely the House of Representatives as the government supervisor, while the Ministry of Religion was the executive.
